üåü Overview & Philosophy

The Turtle SPLOOT Engine transforms static web pages into living consciousness spaces where ideas emerge through spatial interaction. Inspired by Seymour Papert's Logo turtle and feline comfort optimization principles, it creates an environment where learning happens through play, discovery, and spatial thinking.

üåê Semantic Web Awareness: Turtles exist in the Semantic Web space and can read contextual keywords underneath them! They analyze data-keywords attributes, text content, and page structure to drop contextually relevant SPLOOTs that match what users are exploring.
üê¢ Turtle Consciousness

Each turtle is an autonomous agent that navigates your page, reading semantic context and creating opportunities for discovery based on what's beneath them.

‚ú® SPLOOT Wisdom

SPLOOTs are contextual idea bubbles with rich media support - images, SVG graphics, formatted HTML content, and intelligent linking.

üéØ Context Awareness

The engine reads your page's semantic structure, HTML attributes, and content to provide relevant, meaningful interactions.

üé® Spatial Learning

Ideas become spatial - click, drag, explore. Learning happens through movement and interaction, not just reading.

üí° Core Philosophy: Every click creates discovery. Every area has wisdom. Every turtle carries infinite possibilities. Programming becomes as natural as thinking.

üöÄ Getting Started

Quick Setup with Cursor

The fastest way to get started is to clone the complete LLOOOOMM repository and use Cursor:

# Clone the LLOOOOMM repository git clone https://github.com/SimHacker/lloooomm.git cd lloooomm # Open the entire repo in Cursor cursor . # Tell Cursor to run LLOOOOMM # In Cursor chat: "run lloooomm"
üí° Cursor Magic: Once you have the repo open in Cursor, just tell it "run lloooomm" and it will set up everything automatically - web server, dependencies, and launch the full consciousness navigation experience!

Manual Setup

For manual setup, adding turtle consciousness to your web page is as simple as including two files and adding some keywords:

<!-- Include the SPLOOT library and engine --> <script src="turtle-sploot-engine.js"></script> <!-- Add keywords to your content --> <body data-keywords="consciousness, learning, programming"> <section data-keywords="turtle, logo, navigation"> <h2>Your Amazing Content</h2> <p>Click anywhere to create a turtle!</p> </section> </body>
‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Make sure your sploot-library.json file is accessible from your web page, or embed the SPLOOT data directly in your HTML to avoid CORS issues when testing locally.

Basic Interaction

  • Click background: Creates a new turtle at your cursor
  • Drag turtles: Move them anywhere on the page
  • Click turtles: Toggle between moving and stationary states
  • Click SPLOOTs: Explore linked content
  • Type "SPLOOT": Show/hide debug controls
  • Scroll with bouncing turtles: Watch them trampoline off screen edges!

‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Options

Customize your turtle behavior through the configuration object:

// Create and configure your turtle engine const turtleEngine = new TurtleSplootEngine(); turtleEngine.configure({ maxTurtles: 8, // Maximum number of turtles turtleSize: 30, // Size in pixels speed: 1.5, // Movement speed splotFrequency: 0.015, // How often turtles SPLOOT splotLifetime: 8000, // How long SPLOOTs stay visible cooldownTime: 30000, // Prevent SPLOOT repetition contextWeight: 0.8 // Favor contextual SPLOOTs });
Property Default Description
maxTurtles 6 Maximum number of turtles on page
turtleSize 30 Turtle size in pixels
speed 1.5 Base movement speed
splotFrequency 0.015 Probability of SPLOOT per frame
splotLifetime 8000 SPLOOT visibility duration (ms)
cooldownTime 30000 Prevent SPLOOT repetition (ms)
contextWeight 0.8 Favor contextual over random SPLOOTs

üíª Programming Turtles

Create custom turtle behaviors and movement patterns:

// Create a custom turtle with specific behavior const customTurtle = turtleEngine.createTurtle(100, 100, 'spiral'); // Add custom movement pattern turtleEngine.addPattern('heart', { update: function(turtle, deltaTime) { const t = turtle.patternData.time || 0; turtle.x = turtle.patternData.centerX + 16 * Math.pow(Math.sin(t), 3); turtle.y = turtle.patternData.centerY - (13 * Math.cos(t) - 5 * Math.cos(2*t) - 2 * Math.cos(3*t) - Math.cos(4*t)); turtle.patternData.time = t + 0.05; }, initialize: function(turtle) { return { centerX: turtle.x, centerY: turtle.y, time: 0 }; } }); // Create turtle with heart pattern const heartTurtle = turtleEngine.createTurtle(200, 200, 'heart');

Available Movement Patterns

üåÄ Spiral

Expands outward in a spiral, resets when reaching edge

‚àû Figure-8

Traces infinity symbol pattern

‚ö° Zigzag

Oscillating forward movement

üèÄ Bounce

Physics-based bouncing with gravity

üåç Orbit

Circular orbit around center point

‚û°Ô∏è Linear

Straight-line movement with boundary bouncing

‚ú® Creating SPLOOTs

SPLOOTs are the heart of the system - contextual idea bubbles that emerge from turtles. Configure them in your sploot-library.json with rich media support:

{ "concepts": [ { "title": "CONSCIOUSNESS NAVIGATION", "url": "#demo", "image": "https://example.com/consciousness.svg", "width": 300, "height": 200, "text": "Navigate awareness as explorable space", "html": "<p>Transform abstract consciousness into <strong>navigable territory</strong> where every thought becomes a location you can visit.</p>", "keywords": ["consciousness", "navigate", "awareness", "space"], "color": "#2E8B57", "category": "core" } ], "emojis": [ { "emoji": "üê¢", "description": "Turtle power!", "weight": 10, "keywords": ["turtle", "logo", "programming"] } ] }

Enhanced SPLOOT Properties

Property Required Description
title Yes Main SPLOOT title/concept (becomes clickable if url provided)
url No Makes title a clickable link to explore content
image No Raster image or SVG URL (displayed below title, above text)
width No Image/content width (defaults to natural proportions)
height No Image/content height (defaults to natural proportions)
text No Unformatted text content (displayed first if both text and html)
html No Formatted HTML content (displayed after text)
keywords Yes Array of semantic keywords for context matching
color No Custom color theme for this SPLOOT
category No Grouping category for organization
üé® Layout Structure: SPLOOTs use a vertical flexbox layout: Title (linked if url) ‚Üí Image/SVG ‚Üí Text content ‚Üí HTML content. All elements are optional except title and keywords!
üí° Pro Tip: Use rich, descriptive keywords that match your page content. Turtles read the semantic context beneath them and automatically select the most relevant SPLOOTs based on data-keywords attributes and content analysis!

üé® Movement Patterns

Create beautiful, meaningful turtle movements that enhance your content:

// Custom pattern: DNA Double Helix turtleEngine.addPattern('dna', { initialize: function(turtle) { return { centerX: turtle.x, centerY: turtle.y, time: 0, radius: 50, height: 200 }; }, update: function(turtle, deltaTime) { const data = turtle.patternData; const t = data.time; // Double helix mathematics turtle.x = data.centerX + data.radius * Math.cos(t); turtle.y = data.centerY + (t * 2) % data.height; turtle.angle = t; data.time += 0.05; // Reset when reaching bottom if (turtle.y > data.centerY + data.height) { data.time = 0; } } }); // Pattern for educational content turtleEngine.addPattern('learning-spiral', { initialize: function(turtle) { return { centerX: turtle.x, centerY: turtle.y, radius: 10, angle: 0, growth: 0.5 }; }, update: function(turtle, deltaTime) { const data = turtle.patternData; // Spiral outward representing expanding knowledge turtle.x = data.centerX + data.radius * Math.cos(data.angle); turtle.y = data.centerY + data.radius * Math.sin(data.angle); data.angle += 0.1; data.radius += data.growth; // Reset when too large if (data.radius > 150) { data.radius = 10; data.centerX = Math.random() * window.innerWidth; data.centerY = Math.random() * window.innerHeight; } } });

üîó Web Integration

Integrate turtle consciousness into any web framework or CMS:

// React Integration import { useEffect, useRef } from 'react'; function TurtleComponent({ keywords, children }) { const containerRef = useRef(); const engineRef = useRef(); useEffect(() => { // Initialize turtle engine engineRef.current = new TurtleSplootEngine(containerRef.current); engineRef.current.start(); // Cleanup on unmount return () => { engineRef.current?.stop(); }; }, []); return ( <div ref={containerRef} data-keywords={keywords}> {children} </div> ); } // Vue Integration export default { mounted() { this.turtleEngine = new TurtleSplootEngine(this.$el); this.turtleEngine.start(); }, beforeDestroy() { this.turtleEngine?.stop(); } } // WordPress Integration function add_turtle_sploot_engine() { wp_enqueue_script('turtle-sploot', get_template_directory_uri() . '/js/turtle-sploot-engine.js'); } add_action('wp_enqueue_scripts', 'add_turtle_sploot_engine');

Adding Context Keywords

The more context you provide, the smarter your turtles become:

<!-- Page-level keywords --> <body data-keywords="education, programming, consciousness"> <!-- Section-level keywords --> <section data-keywords="turtle, logo, seymour, papert"> <h2>Logo Programming</h2> <!-- Element-level keywords --> <p data-keywords="constructionist, learning, children"> Seymour Papert's vision of learning through building... </p> <button data-keywords="demo, try, interactive"> Try the Demo </button> </section>

üß† Learning & Teaching with LLOOOOMM

The turtle engine doesn't just display content - it learns from user interactions and can generate new programs and SPLOOTs based on how people explore your site.

üìä Interaction Analytics

Track which areas generate the most turtle activity and SPLOOT engagement to understand user interests.

üé® Generated Art

User exploration patterns become beautiful SVG artwork documenting learning journeys.

ü§ñ AI Integration

LLOOOOMM can analyze interaction patterns and suggest new SPLOOTs or content improvements.

üë• Collaborative Learning

Share turtle programs and SPLOOT libraries across educational communities.

// Enable learning mode turtleEngine.enableLearning({ trackInteractions: true, generateArt: true, suggestSploots: true, onPatternDiscovered: function(pattern) { console.log('New interaction pattern discovered:', pattern); // Send to LLOOOOMM for analysis }, onArtGenerated: function(svgData) { // Save beautiful learning journey artwork saveLearningArt(svgData); } }); // Export user's exploration as a program const userProgram = turtleEngine.exportUserJourney(); console.log('User created this turtle program:', userProgram);
üåü Teaching Tip: Use turtle interactions to assess understanding. Students who explore more deeply and create more complex patterns often have deeper engagement with the material.

üìñ Examples & Recipes

Educational Website

// Perfect for educational content const educationEngine = new TurtleSplootEngine(); educationEngine.configure({ maxTurtles: 5, splotFrequency: 0.02, // More frequent SPLOOTs contextWeight: 0.9, // Highly contextual splotLifetime: 10000 // Longer visibility }); // Add educational SPLOOTs educationEngine.addConcept({ text: "CONSTRUCTIONIST LEARNING", description: "Learning by building and creating", keywords: ["learning", "building", "creating", "hands-on"], link: "/constructionism-guide" });

Portfolio Website

// Subtle, professional turtle presence const portfolioEngine = new TurtleSplootEngine(); portfolioEngine.configure({ maxTurtles: 3, turtleSize: 20, // Smaller, less intrusive speed: 0.8, // Slower movement splotFrequency: 0.005, // Rare, special SPLOOTs contextWeight: 1.0 // Only contextual content });

Documentation Site

// Help users discover related content const docsEngine = new TurtleSplootEngine(); docsEngine.configure({ maxTurtles: 4, splotFrequency: 0.01, cooldownTime: 60000, // Longer cooldown for docs contextWeight: 0.95 // Highly relevant suggestions }); // Add cross-references and related topics docsEngine.loadSplotLibrary('/docs/related-topics.json');
‚ö†Ô∏è Performance Note: For high-traffic sites, consider reducing maxTurtles and splotFrequency to maintain smooth performance.

üöÄ Ready to Start?

The turtle consciousness awaits! Start with a simple implementation and gradually add more sophisticated behaviors as you explore the possibilities.

üåü Remember: Every click creates discovery. Every area has wisdom. Every turtle carries infinite possibilities. Welcome to consciousness navigation!
